p: Measurement of the 2,2-diphenyl-1-picrylhydrazyl (DPPH) (Sigma-Aldrich, Mexico) radical scavenging capacity was carried out according to Karamać et al.[ 27] Briefly, two mL of 0.5 mmol/L DPPH in methanol (Meyer, México) was mixed with 100 μL of different concentrations of essential oil of S. macrostema and using major pure terpenes in it (limonene, linalool, pulegone, menthone, thymol, and caryophyllene; Sigma-Aldrich, Mexico) (0.001, 0.01, 0.1, and 1.0 mg/mL). After 20 min incubation, the absorbance was measured at 517 nm with ultraviolet–visible (UV/VIS) spectrophotometer (Genesys 10UV, Thermo Scientific).
